ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became acquainted with an array of Jewish magical traditions that I would not have been exposed to otherwise.
- Interrelatedness of the world - critical analysis of very minute details

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: you'll never take a class like this ever again. Weaknesses: you'll never take a class like this ever again. This class has a steep learning curve but it's definitely a unique experience.
The professor is amazing and I love the amount of primary source work
Strengths- Alessia is the sweetest and most understanding professor... she truly cares and takes time to explain any questions you may have Weaknesses- none, but early mornings are tough

Strengths: Professor Bellusci is a fantastic lecturer, and our frequent trips to other places like the Beinecke and Sterling made me feel like we were fully utilizing the resources Yale had to offer. The course itself is also extremely interesting. Weakness: each lecture is quite long because we only meet once a week-- it can be a little hard to focus around the 1-hour mark. Maybe having a short break in the middle might help?

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it was very interesting and I'm glad I took it
Yes, I cant say enough good things about this class
Absolutely!!!! This is the coolest class I have taken at yale and I enjoyed each reading and discussion.
Yes. I think it's a really fascinating course, and even though it initially doesn't seem particularly pertinent to daily life, it really changes your perspective on the world.
